excerpt: Not a single day passes without finding a multi-type TypeScript entity that messes your code. Successful API responses can adopt multiple shapes. Collections may contain many types within it. Parsed user inputs can collapse to different scalars. It's excepected. That's why TypeScript support Unions.
title: On TypeScript discriminated unions
categories: property does not exist on type any typescript
property does not exist on type 'window & typeof globalthis'
